title: Woman ‘kicked off plane because she had a severe nut allergy’
text:
Meleri Williams, 20, alerted flight attendants to warn them (Picture: Wales News)

A woman with a severe nut allergy says she was removed from a flight when she told staff.

Meleri Williams, 20, alerted flight attendants to warn them, expecting that they would help her by not serving nuts on the flight and making an announcement asking people not to eat them.

Instead, staff from the airline Aerolineas Argentinas told her to get off the plane.

Cardiff University student Meleri, who is training to be a teacher, said she was ‘shocked’ by the ban.

She had been due to fly from Buenos Aires to Esquel in Patagonia to start volunteering at a primary school.

Instead of taking her £200 flight, she ended up having to get a bus which took 26 hours to go the 1,150 miles.

Aerolineas Argentinas is Argentina’s largest airline (Picture: Getty)

Meleri said: ‘My allergy is very severe and could lead to anaphylactic shock where my airways could close up and I could potentially die.

‘I do carry an Epipen but did not want to put myself in a position where there was a high risk and I could suffer from an allergic reaction midflight.

‘I explained that I could develop an anaphylactic shock if I was in an enclosed environment where nuts are consumed, but they didn’t seem to understand.

‘The only food they had for their passengers was packets of dried fruit and nuts.

‘They said that it would affect a greater number of people if nuts wouldn’t be served.

Meleri Williams, 20, ended up taking a bus instead (Picture: Wales News Service)

‘There was a lot of fuss, I was very upset by the end I must say and then having to just walk away was awful. It was very distressing trying to explain everything.’

Meleri, fom Hendy, Carmarthenshire, tried to book with Argentina’s largest airline again on the trip home – but was met with the same response.

She said: ‘We tried booking another flight and thought maybe if we gave them a warning it would be okay, but once again, they said it would be impossible.’

Meleri claims she is yet to receive any response from the airline to her complaint.

The airline based in Buenos Aires has so far not responded to a request for a comment.

description: Meleri Williams, 20, alerted flight attendants to warn them, expecting that they would help her by not serving nuts on the flight.
